DataElement.preferredName: Best Overall Response Sponsor Defined Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents the short code for the best overall disease response as defined by the sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Lesion Best Overall Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Best Overall Response Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
Unable to be evaluated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: At a point before the usual, expected, or specified time.

Concepts.definition: At a point before the usual, expected, or specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on physical exam, such as palpation.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on physical exam, such as palpation.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Response without Minimal Residual Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complete response with no detectable signs of disease.

Concepts.longName: Complete Response without Minimal Residual Disease
Concepts.definition: Complete response with no detectable signs of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An improvement in one or more hematologic cell counts.

Concepts.definition: An improvement in one or more hematologic cell counts.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

Concepts.longName: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.22 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002191. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lack of expected or desired effect related to a therapy.

Concepts.definition: The lack of expected or desired effect related to a therapy.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.22 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002191. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: remainder of a tumor or a neoplasm/cancer after primary, potentially curative therapy.

Concepts.definition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease status just prior to the start of the preparative regimen for hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT): Primary refractory refers to never achieving a complete remission (CR) from any therapy and also not being in partial remission (PR) at the time of the last evaluation prior to HSCT.  PR could have been achieved at some point, but the recipient is no longer in PR.

Concepts.definition: Disease status just prior to the start of the preparative regimen for hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT): Primary refractory refers to never achieving a complete remission (CR) from any therapy and also not being in partial remission (PR) at the time of the last evaluation prior to HSCT.  PR could have been achieved at some point, but the recipient is no longer in PR.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Best Overall Response Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Clearly characterized or delimited.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
